Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Dans062
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights as a long weekend break. The hotel is located in a very quiet area and we had asked to be put in the annex, behind the courtyard which is notably quieter anyway and we weren't disappointed. The room was small but lovely with nice furnishings and a lovely power shower in the bathroom. A hairdryer was provided but was pretty ineffective so I would suggest you take your own. There was an ironing board and iron in the wardrobe and a 'free' safe. The only complaint I would have about the annex is that there's no lift and although only 2 floors high, it's still a bit of a drag having to haul luggage up 2 flights of stairs. The rooms were kept clean and the staff were friendly on reception. The reception and dining areas were immaculate. We didn't use the room service for food so can't comment on that but the breakfasts were ok - typical continental style with croissants in abundance and meats and bread. No full English though, only boiled eggs which you had to boil yourself. We tried the tea but it wasn't very nice so stuck to coffee. The staff in the dining room weren't at all friendly and only one spoke some English. We got the feeling they didn't particularly like us (tourists). Paris is lovely and we thoroughly enjoyed our trip, visiting all the usual touristy attractions. The hotel is conveniently placed (about 5-7 minute walk) to nearest metro and I would have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone looking for a long weekend break just off the beaten track.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: smcooper77
Reviews.Content: I stayed her quite awhile ago, with my daughters. We had a great time for the four days we spent here. It's clean, with all the necessary amenities and nothing over the top. It was very reasonably priced, and had a friendly front desk. The breakfast was typically french, fresh, simple and delicious. The croissants, cheese and other selections were bang on. It has a nice little bar for an evening drink and a charming patio in the garden out back. When I return to Paris, I will be returning here. It is about a 7 minute walk to the metro and I loved the residential neighbourhood it was situated in. It was a genuine slice of Parisian life.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel, staff very friendly and professional”
Reviews.Author: Antonia K
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from the 1st-5th March 2012. I had a single room which was perfectly adequate, bed comfortable very clean. Free wifi for personal use also iron and ironing board. Breakfast was good cold meats/cheeses, variety of croissants and breads plus fresh orange juice Monday to Friday. Metro and RER within 5 minute walk. As I was travelling alone and arriving late departing early I used the Super Shuttle service which was excellent and took about 45 minutes. Would recommend this hotel, staff very friendly and professional. Excellent little restaurant 3 minutes away Ba-Yen.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Graham P
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel in a quiet residential area. Its not too far from the Arc de Triumphe and only a few minutes from the metro/RER station. All the staff were really friendly and helpful. The rooms were typical for this type of hotel but they were well appointed and clean. There are some really nice local shops close by and an interesting food market only a couple of minutes away They had a special weekend internet rate which was fantastic value. It worked out at 145 Euros for 2 nights including breakfast. With the hotel having free wi-fi in the rooms I think its hard to beat for value We would definitely stay there again if we return to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable little hotel in the 17th arrondissement”
Reviews.Author: Jaana_01
Reviews.Content: We had a "minimoon" in Paris in the end of January and were slightly concerned about the hotel before arrival. It turned out to be very nice. The staff were professional and polite, the room in the annex was modern and had a large bathroom, and the buffet breakfast was a good selection of continental produce served in a small pleasant breakfast room. The small patio would be lovely in the summer but it was too cold to enjoy it in January! The metro station (Pereire) was 5 minutes walk away, and there were several good local restaurants nearby. The location was slightly towards the outskirts of the city, but it was peaceful and in a good area. I would recommend this for a short break for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel at a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: Julie S
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel! We stayed here over New Year and we were able to get a reasonable price for our stay. The rooms were clean, warm and modern. The hotel staff were lovely and friendly and organised our transport to the airport. We had breakfast included in our deal, one morning we had it delivered to the room - it was beautifully presented with a fantastic selection of pastries, fruit, yoghurts and breads. It is in a nice area with good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Believe The Positive Reviews.”
Reviews.Author: JaimeCanterbury
Reviews.Content: Firstly,thanks to previous reviewers for helping us choose this hotel.Tripadvisor at its best.The Hotel,surrounding area and general info were exactly as described.We had originally planned on a three night break over Christmas but due to a very attractive offer of Euro 74 per night b&b on the hotel website we went for six nights.Worth every single cent. Room comfortable and clean.Larger than expected bath/shower.Firm mattress.Quiet,slept like logs [second floor] Breakfast ample,FRESH ORANGE JUICE !! Staff at reception,chambermaids,breakfast ladies,professional and friendly. Free WiFi,safe in the room.Pleasant garden area.General area middle class and not at all touristy.Easy access to metro and local restaurants and shops. Whether you're on a budget or just want good value for money,you should consider this hotel. Tip ; The breakfast room,open 7.00-10.00, is fine when quiet but for busier periods I would suggest 7.00 or 9:45,inbetween can be a little chaotic.Being winter and quiet we were lucky every day but one.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, small room, didn't make up bed or clean bedroom.”
Reviews.Author: Me-from-the-UK
Reviews.Content: Nice enough hotel with friendly staff and a good breakfast. Bathroom was small, with no bath and a tiny shower. Maybe it was because I forgot to leave my key when I went out for the day, but they didn't clean the room or make up my bed. Bedroom was overloooking an internal garden, and it was very quiet and easy to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, good rooms, best value”
Reviews.Author: marktodandtravel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Magellan is amazing! It isn't the largest, fanciest, or most central to the tourist sites, but that all makes it better. It's a place that's cozy enough that after a day or two you get to chat up the lady replacing the food at breakfast, and they start remembering your name at the cafe down the street. It's far enough that you aren't surrounded by angry tourists, but rather locals who think your use of french is 'quaint.' Checkin - Easy Rooms - Clean, safe, with a full bathroom. Not the largest, but this is Paris. Location - Not walking distance to any major tourist sites, but the location is amazing. You're surrounded by locals with plenty of great cafes nearby and you're only a subway away from anything you really want to see. Cleanliness - Perfect Staff - Pleasant I will happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Pure_L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, and encountered no problems during our stay. The hotel is very clean with a nice polished finish throughout, our room was a bit on the small side but big enough and more than we were expecting. Nice sized bathroom with a bath and a fantastic hot shower. 10 minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe, but less than 5 minute walk from the Porte de Champerret metro station which can take you to any of the sites within 10-15 mins.. Breakfast was nice, and better than what you will get in most of the café's around the area. Staff were very friendly, and had very good english. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: Adam M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Magellan for a long weekend in Paris (Friday - Monday) and it offered us everything that we needed and more. The Hotel is situated close to bars and restaurants and so there are enough places to eat out in the evening and at lunch. I would recommend the guy making the crepes in the bistro up by the metro! The metro is only 5 minutes walk and can easily get to all the main attractions in Paris. The hotel itself is very smart, clean and tidy. All the people who work there are very friendly and very helpful. The rooms were nice too, with a comfortable bed, a spacious en suite, small balcony and enough room to swing a few cats. The breakfast was continental and very nice indeed. Plenty to eat and can easily fill up on breakfast for the day ahead! Overall, really enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a nice break in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A great value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: prain4u
Reviews.Content: I spent only one night here (November 13, 2011). My room was clean and roomy--especially by European standards. The room was also fairly modern-looking in appearance. The staff members were polite and helpful. The reception staff members seemed to be fluent in both English and French. They arranged for a shuttle to take me to Charles de Gaulle Airport (25 Euros). The hotel was not located extremely close to the Arc de Triomphe or the other major tourist sites. However, it was not located extremely far away from such sites either--if you don't mind walking a bit. It was a fairly quiet neighborhood. I would probably try to stay here again if I came to Paris--and I would not check what other hotels were offering. I experienced no problems here and my stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: CanadaArch
Reviews.Content: Spent a week with my wife in July. Off the beaten path in a quiet residential neighbourhood. ery realxing after a busy day in paris. Easy access to Champs Elysee and Metro. Very clean and modern room though a little small but nice. Large WC. Very quiet room overlooking small courtyard with tables and chairs outside. Great breakfast buffet. Overall a delight.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice Parisien hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike_2706
Reviews.Content: My room was very clean, modern and well appointed with a comfortable bed. The reception staff were friendly and efficient and the breakfast was, as other reviewers have noted, very good. Again, as mentioned by others, the transport links were good with a metro station and RER station both in easy walking distance and I went to 2 restaurants local to the hotel and had good food and service at both. The hotel is a little out of central Paris but it is in a very nice residential area and this makes it I think - you don't get the usual poor Paris service and attitude. There are plenty of excellent restaurants in easy walking distance from the hotel, and plenty of shops, banks and other retail amenities if needed. I'll be going back to the Magellan on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms and fantastic Continental breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: gladiator99
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this hotel in Paris and the rooms were very nice and the continental breakfasts were fantastic. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It is reasonably close to subway and good restaruants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Inscribed
Reviews.Content: Great location and area. Easy for Metro and walking, and lots of restaurants. Nice rooms, well furnished and clean Terrific breakfast - especially pleasant on the patio. Wonderful front desk staff. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect quite hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilsebein
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Magellan for 6 nights - friendly service - good breakfast - fresh orange juice ! - café au lait croissants - fresh fruits - small breakfast room. Nice lobby with bar. Rooms a quite - small but clean. Not a source of luxury but the value for the price is very good. Location nearby metrostation. Nice restaurants around. Comfortable area.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location, helpful staff, excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: clairelouisemcfall
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the positive reviews I'd read here and was glad I'd relied on them. The hotel is in quite a narrow one-way street. The neighbourhood is very lovely with predominantly Haussmanian architecture, some shops and bistros and pretty public gardens. The metro, which is clean and feels safe, is a 5 minute walk but be prepared for a bit of a struggle to buy your tickets from the machine as it's not easy... Back to the hotel. The reception staff were nothing but helpful and friendly and offered advice about the metro and taxis when I asked. The lounge and reception area is very stylishly decorated and is modern and clean. There is a very pretty courtyard at the back of the hotel, with tables and chairs and well kept borders with several trees, including a fig tree. The breakfast room is, again, modern and clean but maybe lacking the same charm as elsewhere - that being said the food is great; variety of cheeses and meats, eggs to boil yourself (you take an egg timer from the table), yoghurts, pastries and breads. There's a machine than makes fresh orange juice as you wait which was very popular. The waiting staff will bring you tea/coffee and are lovely, too. Our room was on the 5th floor at the front. We heard only a little noise on the Saturday night (people coming out of nearby bars), and the bin men and deliveries in the early morning. It didn't bother us, but if you want even more peace and quiet a room at the back would be more suitable. That our room was at the front was fabulous as we could see straight into the gorgeous apartments over the road! The bedroom was small, as we expected, but it was clean and pretty and quiet. There is no air-con but there are HUGE windows with external mechanical shutters if you want an additional sense of security and darkness at night (not that we used them). I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Noosiekins
Reviews.Content: The hotel's smack in the middle of a residential area. our room faced the road & w/ the weather being super hot and there are NO AC in the room (note. ASK FOR A FAN FROM THE FRONT DESK), there were nights where we had to keep our windows open....It's a wee bit noisy at times but you really can't fault the hotel for the banging trucks or people partying down the road. Breakfast was the best thing at the hotel! great service staff and great OJ juicer!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect long weekend get away!”
Reviews.Author: suffolkgirl25
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a short walk from the Metro Pereire, we used the metro a couple of days, but there were bikes you can hire around the city with one base being not too far from the hotel. The rooms were comfortable and clean, breakfast was lovely. The guy who works on the breakfast shift was super busy but always made sure everything on the breakfast counter was stocked up and that tea and coffee was served promptly. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, compact and terrific location”
Reviews.Author: asdfgal
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for three nights and had a fantastic time. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is a little off the beaten track, but close to the Metro Station Pereire (which is also a RER station so handy for Versailles). We didn't eat in the restaurant because there were so many excellent cafes nearby, but did have room service one night - excellent and fast. The walk to the metro was through a perfectly manicured public garden - just heaven! We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: llecomte
Reviews.Content: Far from the city center, but easily accessible by train/metro, the Magellan offers quality service. We found the staff to be pleasant, friendly and helpful. The lobby is nicely furnished and fresh. There is a small garden terrace in wish guest can enjoy meals and drinks. The hotel is clean and pleasant. They're a few disadvantages: there was no air conditioning in our room. Luckily, we could open the window. Our bed was comfortable, but too small and thus we did not get a good night sleep. The washroom was large, clean and newly renovated, but we could not open the window to freshen the air. None the less, the room was clean. A breakfast buffet was included in our stay package: cereal, breads, croissants, chocolatines, and a toaster allowed you to make your own toast, a boiler to boil your own egg, cold cut meats, fruits and cheeses. The food was fresh, but became redundant after one week. Especially, if you enjoy a hot breakfast once in a while such as we do. Despite these few inconveniences, I would highly recommend the Magellan.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kolaman
Reviews.Content: Maximum 2 guests per room and rooms are small. Had to take another room since we had 2 kids, aged 8 &12. Must be very careful booking rooms on Priceline.com in Paris. Initial search on Priceline does not give option to select number of adults & number of children. Hotel is ok for 2 people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Ge0rge86
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 7 nights in our honeymoon, it was a nice hotel, the breakfast was good but the same every day (like majority of 3-4 stars hotels). The room was pretty small but it was good enought for sleeping. The wi-fi worked well. The location is good but not excellent, from airport you must get s1 train and change another 2 metros for magellan. Arc de triomphe is a 15 minutes walk. Or 5 stations with 2 metro lines (15-20 minutes). You cand find a good pizza at 2 blocks away (Arc de triomphe direction).

Reviews.Title: “I am returning to this hotel for the 3rd time!”
Reviews.Author: stoneytravellers
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a family of 4 (2 girls 13 &10) - and 2 rooms booked. We arrived very early for check-in. They quickly had a room made up for us within the hour. The rooms are small but very clean. There is some storage space. Breakfast was fine and the courtyard is beautiful. We found the staff to be friendly and courteous. The location is in a quiet residential area, very close to 2 metro stations. I am now planning to return for our 3rd visit in September. I would highly recommend this hotel, especially from a value perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Semmian
Reviews.Content: Very clean, modern In a nice area, short walk to Arc Metro close by Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: jannymons
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while on a small group tour. Our room faced the street with apartments across from us. We could hear the laughter and music but things quieted down after 11:00. The rooms are small but the floor to ceiling french style windows open and there is a small balcony to stand on. The buffet breakfast served downstairs (included) was limited but very good ( boiled eggs, toast, croissants, other pastry, yoghurt, cheeses and cold cuts). There is also a lovely outside courtyard. It's about a 15 minute walk to the Arc de Triumph and the Metro. I would stay there again. Beware of taxi drivers in Paris. You can get ripped off especially by the African drivers who do not know the city all that well and will take their time trying to find your hotel (esp. if it's not one of the top five in the city) all the while the meter is running.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and modern with a pretty courtyard”
Reviews.Author: innaMontreal
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant week's stay at the Magellan in late April/early May 2011. On some days it was warm enough to have breakfast in the very pretty, nicely landscaped courtyard. Hotel was refurbished not too long ago -- decor is modern with a warm, cosy feel and everything seems in good condition. There are comfy sitting areas, a bar stand near reception and an enclosed courtyard always open to hotel's guests. A small computer room can be used for a fee (1 hour 6€, 15 min 2€) and Wi-Fi in rooms is free. A kettle, tea and coffee are provided in all rooms, not usual for Paris and quite convenient. Breakfast is continental with a good selection including freshly squeezed OJ, some fruits and cheeses, fromage frais, yogurt and the usual rolls, coffee, etc. I asked in advance for a quiet room and we were given a good sized twin facing the lovely, peaceful courtyard. Staff were all polite and welcoming, the place is kept really clean and is on a pleasant street in an elegant neighbourhood. There are many shops and services close to hotel, including a small Franprix supermarket on rue Bayen and a Carrefour City at 85/89 rue Laugier (open daily 7am-10pm, Sun 9am-1pm). The charming market street rue Poncelet and the Ternes covered market (at 8bis rue Lebon, open Tue to Sat) are near. And nearby avenue des Ternes is lined with shops and eateries, and also rue Courcelles -- with some nice clothes and shoe boutiques. Arc de Triomphe is within a pleasant 15 minute stroll, as is the lovely Monceau park. Two metro stations are just a couple of blocks from hotel and also very convenient buses -- the 84 bus (Mon-Sat) goes to the Panthéon/Latin Quarter, passing Madeleine, place de la Concorde, Orsay Museum, Luxembourg Garden, etc on the way. And the 92 bus runs daily and goes to the Arc/Champs-Élysées and near the Eiffel Tower, les Invalides and to Montparnasse Tower/area. The location, however, isn't convenient to RER B train to airport. And, since it isn't central, it's best for people who are comfortable with using public transport.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: willey1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March 2011 and it was perfect. We arrived at 10am from Canada and they had our rooms ready! Check in was a breeze. The staff was very helpful, fully bilingual and very friendly. Rooms are small but that is the norm in Europe. My husband and I had a double bed but it wasn't too cramped at all. A Plus was the safe in our room. You enter your own PIN for the safe which made us both feel a little safer. The hotel is located close to 2 metro lines which can take you directly to tourist locations in Paris. It is also in walking distance of the Arc de Triomphe. We enjoyed the breakfast ( it is 15 euro per person per day). Kind of expensive for what you get but the freshly squeeze orange juice was delicious. Breakfast staff were very friendly as well! We travelled with another couple and their baby and staff got a play pen and bath toys ready for the baby at no additionaly charge! There are many restaurants, bakeries and a grocery store that are very close! Highly recommend checking out the bakeries!! There is also a little courtyard in the back to enjoy your breakfast. All in all, I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to couples or singles.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: missmeg1
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely experience at this hotel. Stayed for 3 nights and was made to feel very welcome. Everyone was polite and extremely helpful when we asked numerous times what metro or how far a certain place to visit was. They even provided little metro maps and street maps free of charge on the reception desk. The breakfast was lovely and very enjoyable, the hotel was spotless and rooms very clean and cleaned every day we were there. Pleasant area outside to have a drink. Very short walk to nearest Metro. What else can I say but a very nice hotel with very pleasant and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good honest hotel, rooms clean, staff friendly, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Crossrjc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying three nights in this clean and friendly hotel, rooms are compact, bathroom clean and toiletries supplied. Breakfast at hotel excellent, typical continental fare, small bar as well. Location of hotel is close to Metro and local buses, 15 minute walk to Arc de Triomphe. Hotel great for a short trip tp Paris. Have to mention Eurostar - what a great service this proved to be on time going to and returned a minute early!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: PDP45
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly atmosphere, great breakfast, but a bit like every hotel in Paris somewhat small rooms. Not exactly in the center, but near Metro station. When back in Paris, will certainly keep it in mind !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice smaller hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindaOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and myself stayed here for 6 days in August 2010. The hotel was small but very clean, nice garden court yard, breakfast was good, staff helpful when they could be. The room was small by our standards but we had a small balcony which was a very nice addition. It was quite a walk to the tourist areas but we did it most days. The area wasn't the best, a bar across the street closed not sure if that was permanent, never opened while we were staying there. An Indian resturant on the corner, also closed, under reno. A grocery store, fair size, just around the corner, bus station 2 blocks or so. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely return to that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: elliejay
Reviews.Content: It is a good clean hotel. The room was very small but was adequate for a 5 day stay. The bed linen was changed during the stay and the towels changed as frequently as you wished. The breakfast was good, continental style, with plenty to choose from (meats, cheese, eggs, croissants, pain au chocolat, fresh fruit juice). The female receptionist definitely needs some customer service training, she was looking down on guests and laughing at them and had a very bad attitude, obviously in the wrong job. Not a good first impression of the hotel, the management need to be aware of the staff representing them. The room was very hot, there is no air conditioning but we asked for a fan which we got but had to go and get it from downstairs ourselves. The temperature in the room made it uncomfortable during the night and was difficult to sleep. The outside noise didn't help either but we had to keep the window open. It was very hot and humid in Paris at the end of August. We ordered room service one evening after a busy day sight seeing and not returning till later on so decided to stay in. It was a good menu to choose from but it is not cooked on the premises and is ordered in from a local restaurant. 2 small portions and one dessert was 50 euros, not good value at all. The plates and cutlery were still in the room 2 days later, they had not been taken away by the cleaning staff. The Arc de Triomphe was a good 15-20 minute walk from the hotel, further than is suggested on the website. Overall, it was ok, it was clean which is important, but it is not somewhere I would be in a hurry to stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Never Again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bubbles67
Reviews.Content: The staff in this hotel need some training in how to deal with guests. The lady in the dining room was extremely rude and never once smiled during the 5 days we were there!!! On our last day there was a queue out to the bar as no tables were cleared for guests to sit on and she had a cheek to tell me in front of everyone in the droom saying I had to wait even though we had been waiting 30mins!! There was 1 2-slice toaster for a hotel which had 72 rooms!! On return from shopping at 5.30pm on Sat our room had not been serviced and we had to request towels etc. There was no air con and afetr opening the window to get some aIr in to our pokey room we were bitten by mosquitoes. Never again will we set foot in the Magellan!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel with quiet garden area and easy link to central Paris”
Reviews.Author: kenandnetty
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with helpful staff. Rooms clean with little hanging space but manageable. Very varied choice for breakfast and loved the quiet garden area. Close to Metro and bus depot and we enjoyed the cafes and little parks in the vicinity. Savings to be made buying 10 Metro tickets rather than singles.

Reviews.Title: “My first (and only) Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: TaarenH
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Magellan was a welcome change after staying at a London hostel for a week. It was very quaint, with rooms that weren't huge, but were big enough. Everything was very clean and well taken care of. It was in a great location, a 5-minute walk off a main street, and not a terribly far walk from the Arc de Triomphe. There was a small supermarket about a block away so that we could get less expensive food, and not eat out all the time. It was a little far from the Metro, though, if you were in any sort of hurry. There was a small breakfast room that opened to a very nice inner courtyard with lots of plants. The breakfast was always good, with a nice variety of meats, cheeses, fruit, breads and cereal. You could even watch your orange juice be freshly squeezed in a clear (giant!) juicer. A couple drawbacks would be that there was some construction going on while we were there, and a large part of the lobby was off limits. Also, the phone was broken the entire week we were there, and the Internet was so expensive that no one wanted to use it. Overall, I would say that this hotel was very nice, had a good location and atmosphere, and a few technical difficulties.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful garden, but no air-conditioning!”
Reviews.Author: EusebiaRay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magellan from the 06/07/2010 to the 12/07/2010, as park of a package with Newmarket Holidays. Overall, the hotel was very nice- the rooms were small (but average for Paris), and very clean. The hotel is also situated in a nice area of Paris- close to Metro/RER line C and a bus stop, and about 20 minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe. It also felt safe to walk around at night, and there were plenty of decent restaurants close by. Breakfast was very good (as many people have pointed out, the orange juice machine is amazing!), and the garden outside really is lovely-pefect for sitting in with a drink if you don't want to go out for the evening. We only had a couple of problems with noise. We had a room on the second floor of the hotel, facing the street, and some people in the apartment block opposite had a very loud party on Saturday night which went on until about 4 in the morning (the person on reception that night called the police, and said this happens every Saturday). Also beware that the hotel does not have air-conditioing. This would probably be fine throughout most of the year, but it was uncomfortably hot in July, and the heat made it very diffiicult to sleep. The hotel did give us a fan when we asked for one, however, and I should point out that it was unusually warm for that time of year in Paris (the temperature reached around 38). Overall, good hotel at a reasonable price with a great outdoor area, but very hot!

Reviews.Title: “excellent good value hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: wanderer190762
Reviews.Content: excellent room, good attention to detail. small very helpful and friendly staff very good breakfast, the terrace a big benefit. Location slightly out of tourist areas, but with god metro connections,good cheap restaurants and supermarkets within yards.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Little Hotel but fyi no a/c”
Reviews.Author: glim
Reviews.Content: This was a cute hotel and everything was nice and clean. The only complaint is that there is no a/c so if you're going in the summer be for warned. The rooms do have a big window that you could leave open but two problems with this, 1. if you're facing the street you'll hear cars/bikes/trucks drive through all night long, 2. if you leave it open there is the possibility of mosquitos flying in (my friend found out the hard way waking up 3am to find itchy bite marks all over her arms). Other than the lack of a/c this was a nice hotel, breakfast includes fresh squeezed oj, coffee, boiled eggs, cold meats, yogurt, pastries, cereal. In addition internet/airline check-in/printing boarding pass is not free, was about 2 euros for 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel with a really good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: TravelJoe40
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of March and really enjoyed the Hotel. We liked the location because it is in a residential area away from all of the tourists. There is a nice little park only a few blocks away. There are two subway locactions, one of which includes a RER stop (Perierie). THere are plenty of restaurants and grocery in the area. The only downside are the rooms are small, but it really wasn't that big of a deal. I would go back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chantes
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in the Magellan. We found the room very cosy and very clean. The room was small but had everything we needed, a flat screen TV, a desk, a table with tea and coffee facility and a confortable bed. Breakfast was very good, there was a choice of cereals, eggs, freshly baked croissants, baguette,jam, ham, cheese, fruit and fresh juice. The hotel is located in a quiet street, easy to find and only 8 minutes walk to the Arc de Triomphe. I would certainly go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Madsern
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite small, but cozy. Very clean room with comfy beds. The staff are very helpful. They gave us the best directions every day. The breakfast was good, although there wasnt much to choose from. They have the best orangejuice machine! And as someone else here pointed out, the breakfast room is small, so one morning we had to share a table with someone else. No biggie, but still. The hotel seemed to be in a quiet area, and a 3 minute walk to metro station Porte de Champerret. We had a very pleasant stay at the Magellan, and we will book this hotel again next time were going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: medialla
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The room was lovely, very clean and comfortable. There was a kettle and tea/coffee sachets in the room. Ironing facilities were very nice to discover. Using the underground parking lot was very handy (although parking there was pretty expensive - we did not expect otherwise). The hotel is located in a beautiful district and is within a walking distance from the Arc de Triomphe. An awesome local market with all possible delicacies, as well as cheese and wine shops, bakeries were just a couple of streets away. The only disappointment was the hotel's breakfast. Not that I'd complain about the food, but I would definitely recommend improving the service. The waitresses were so noisy when laying the tables and cleaning that everybody had to speak up. As a result the overall din was so bad we chose to skip our breakfast the next day. Another problem was that there were too few tables for too many people and some had to wait in a queue. We also found the room service to be a rip off. A selection of macarons and canneles was of dubious quality and unreasonably priced. But these things did not manage to spoil our positive impression of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best fresh squeezed orange juice!”
Reviews.Author: Cujo931
Reviews.Content: The hotel was near the Arc de Triomphe. About a 15 minute walk. The area was very quiet and I liked the fact that it wasn't in a touristy area. Our room was very small, but that's common in Parisian hotels. However, we checked into this hotel again after we got back from Nice and we got a surprisingly large room on the top floor. The best part about this hotel was their orange juice during petit dejeuner (breakfast). They had a crazy juicing machine and the orange juice was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Good relation quality - price"”
Reviews.Author: zinho007
Reviews.Content: Following the recommendations given by Tripadvisor, this time I have chosen the Magellan in Paris to stay one night. Friendly personal, good location and very tidy even if small rooms are contributing to a very nice stay. If you need a nice place without spending a fortune to discover Paris - then this is for You. Will certainly not be the last time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: huggy_buggi Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location - very easy to get to the hotel from the metro (we had printed a map to help us initially, but after that didn't need the map again), and from there we found our way to all of the sights. Hotel staff were more than happy to help with directions and any other requests. Room was very tidy and was made up each morning. Only drawback for us was the lack of vegetarian options on the room service menu - from memory there was only a raw vegetable salad - but we used this as an opportunity to eat out. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others, it was very affordable (we booked through a discount hotel website run by octopus travel) and had great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and safe location!!”
Reviews.Author: lilolei
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful with great service. The location was very easy to get to everywhere wants you get your way around paris. The breakfast was good and fresh. It was worth staying here with the breaksfast and cleaniness of the hotel. The watts of the hairdryer is very low if you are use to using american high watts. if you do bring your hairdryer remember to bring a converter that will help with your watts power or the power will go out. We felt safe in this hotel. You also have a safe in your room. The location is not bad. We would usually get back to the hotel late in the morning and walk back to the hotel and felt safe walking back. The other thing is we were the youngest people staying there. But not a problem since we were not really in the hotel. we would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good experience”
Reviews.Author: Thinker-Bell76
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Hotel Magellan on our 3-day trip to Paris. Overall its a fairly decent hotel, good location, & great service. The hotel staff answered all of our questions and we had many since Paris was the 1st stop of our 21-day trip to Europe. The hotel room was nice, clean, cozy and at the quiet corner of the street. The cons: there was no air-conditioning in our room. Thankfully our room was located in the back building where street noise was absolutely non-existent. I personally have a hard time sleeping without any sort of fan or air-conditioning so I was an uncomfortable sleeper at night! For those who are used to no air-conditioning, u shud be fine. Just make sure you ask for a room NOT on the 1st floor and be as far away from the main street (if you get a room with no air-conditioning). Second problem we had was the lack of an elevator -- our room was on the 3rd floor and the staircase to our room was VERY narrow. Only 1 person with a medium-sized suitcase can fit at a time on the staircase. It was annoying to have to carry the luggage upstairs by urself. However the BIG plus of this hotel is the breakfast - it is awesome!!! So make sure you get up on time to take advantage of that! The hotel is a good 15-20 min walk from Champs Elysees & a 10-min walk from the closest metro stop. You might as well stroll down to Champs Elysees. Hotel location is safe! We booked our trip through EuropeanDestinations.com. It's an awesome service - they did a wonderful job of putting together our 21-day itinerary. They knew we were 2 girls traveling alone so they made sure to book us hotels which were safe and this hotel is certainly a safe one for girls traveling alone by themselves. As far as good eating places go, there are some really tasty Mediterranean delis & cafes a few blocks from the hotel on the street of McDonalds. Just ask the hotel staff where McD's is & a few steps down you'll begin to spot see them. Paris was an awesome city overall!!! I will certainly go back there again. Don't miss visiting Notre Dame and the surrounding area. Sacre Ceour is another hot spot - beautiful view of Paris. Its also a 15-min walk from Moulin Rouge. Its NOTHING like the one from the movie :) but you can there for the sake of having visited it. However the walk to Moulin Rouge has some cool boutiques with good shopping bargains.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: HLAE
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night on our way home at the end of a 3 week vacation. We were pleased with everything about the hotel. The room was nice, clean, and a decent size for Paris. Air conditioning would have been nice and it could have used a coat of paint but not major issues. The breakfast was more than we had expected and the staff were pleasant. The location is quiet and a little removed from some of the Paris attractions but it's close to a Metro station so that wasn't an issue. Overall it was a good value and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastique Experience, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: WonderfulParis
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the hotel and we had a great time. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful when we asked for directions, breakfast was good and hotel was spotless. Make sure your remember to try making an effort of saying Merci and Sil vous plait in french and leaving a euro or two as tip and the servers/locals will go out of their way to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Character & Charm”
Reviews.Author: Cullercoats
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this lovely hotel for 5 nights (15th-20th July) and must say how impressed my husband & I were. The area around the hotel was good, with lots of nice restaurants, shops and the metro station Pereire only a few minutes walk away. Our room (503) was well equiped with safe, tea/coffee making, iron & ironing board, plenty of wardrobe space, bathroom with bath, shower over with good pressure, toilet & bidet(bring your own hairdryer as the one supplied not so good). The room was on the top floor overlooking courtyard and was extremely quiet. Used shutters at night & left windows open, no noise except bin men one morning! In Paris we did usual tourist things. I can highly recommend tour of Opera House with English speaking guide at 11.30. Restaurants we liked were: Melrose at Place de Clichy (3 courses plus coffee & wine 38 Euros per person) Wepler fish restaurant also Place de Clichy (3 courses no wine or coffee 24 Euros) Bistro Du 17eme (5 mins walk from hotel went on previous TA revue, thank you it was excellent advice) Bistrot de l'Entrecote 10 place de Marechal Juin (also a few minutes walk from hotel) wonderful steaks! The hotel won an award for exclusive hotels - character & charm in 2007 and I can see why. Spoke to people who had returned on many occassions. Staff couldn't have been nicer. Breakfast good with plenty of choice. Whole hotel very clean. All in all an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: HopeToronto_Ontario
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one week, what a great hotel I read reviews before I booked and everyone said clean, they were not kidding this hotel is spotless! rooms, breakfast room,lobby, courtyard, very very nice! No complaints! Metro and RER a couple of blocks away from hotel so convienent once you get the hang of metro and RER location is very central. Great Pizza around the corner from hotel and many choices of restaurants up the block, great Thai, Chinese, Indian etc. I would definatly stay again hands down! We felt very part of the community! And check out the great Park around the corner! Cheap but very good red wines at the local grocery stores 2 or three in the area! My sister and I are very picky with hotels and we were over joyed with this hotel! Front desk very helpful and spoke english! 3 star hotel with 4 star quality! We did not see any Air conditioner we were lucky enough weather was cool!!! Thumbs up to the Hotel Magellan! Hotel looks better than photos! P.S. Ladies Check out free Fashion shows at Galleries La Fayette You have to registar on line! Loved Paris!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: queenn
Reviews.Content: Lovely, exceptionally clean hotel located off the busy path in a nice residential area. Pictures online do not do the hotel justice. Much nicer in person. The desk staff are helpful and can communicate in english if need be. Rooms are small cozy and cannot emphasize enough clean. 1 english channel CNN, but who cares, nobody comes to Paris to watch TV. The breakfast host greets you with a smile and a much needed pot of hot coffee. Breakfast consists of fruits,breads/pastry,cheeses,coffee,freshly squeezed orange juice,cereals and all types of jam which can be enjoyed in lovely outdoor patio or dining area. The Metro and PER (train) minutes away and all major attractions are easily accessed and close to hotel.( Tip: The Train is faster and can get you to major locations without having to transfer lines like the metro.) Enjoyed my stay at hotel Magellan and would stay again..

Reviews.Title: “magellan review”
Reviews.Author: kostin
Reviews.Content: The room was small, nice and clean. There was no fridge or minibar. No air conditioning - there was a non functional knob on the wall that I didn't know what it does but I haven't seen any AC machine neither some air hole in the wall. The TV had only one channel in English and that was CNN. Wireless internet was available for 5EUR/24hours. Also some photo transferring service was available in the hotel. The breakfast room was nice and small, the breakfast was kind of poor, only 3 meat products:2 types of salami and one type of ham, one type of cheese, a very small ball of sliced tomatoes, milk and cereals. Then sweets like fruit yogurt, nutella, comfiture, fruits cream, croissants, fresh orange juice and coffee. The eggs were extra, for 2 eggs you had to pay 4 EUR. The receptionist gave us, when asked, a Paris map with tourist attractions and metro map. All the personnel was nice. I've booked the room using a German hotel booking website and I paid for the room at the hotel. But the Magellan hotel performed an authorization check on my credit card when I booked the room and placed an authorization hold on 50EUR from my credit card account. This amount was on hold for 30days so I couldn't use that money. I considered this to be an abuse because they could have performed that card authorization check by only blocking me 1EUR from my account. Here are more details about this banking procedure: [--] and you can read the "Other issues with authorization holds" section at the end of the page.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jatl2008
Reviews.Content: This Hotel surprised me. The area is a quaint area in the Northern part of the city about 1 Mile from the Arc de Triump. There are several bakerys near by, coffee shops, grocers and even laundry facilities (we used a do-it-yourself laundry mat instead of the pricy hotel service). Room was very nice...larger than expected, but still small by American standards. Bathroom was large and very nice. Room decor was very nice, modern and stylish. Hotel staff very polite and attentive. Bar area is very nice, and breakfast bar not too bad. If there was any draw back at all was the hotel is not near a tube station and the main street to get a taxi is about a 10 minute walk...not too bad. But for older couples this might prove to be problematic.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: baruray
Reviews.Content: Two nights in this hotel was part of the package that I bought in Air Transat website. Checking in was no problem, I gave them the voucher and they gave me the keys. The reception staff are really nice, as they answer my questions throughout my stay (ie. making local calls, etc...). Your incoming calls are not charged to you, it's free. Only the outcoming calls you make which costs so much, so don't even make any. My hotel room is clean and I got a small balcony which is really nice. There's a safe in the room where you can leave your important stuff. You can reset the password/key code. The breakfast is alright, the waitstaff though aren't that friendly. They asked for my room number, and just walked away, with no smile or thank you. Nothing really outstanding with the breakfast, it's croissants, bread, yogurt, coffee, juice, etc... The only problem I had regarding this place was the location. It is hard to find, especially if you've lost the map of the place, which I did. I was walking around for two hours, looking for it, asking people who don't know. I tried calling the hotel to find out their exact location, but their phone is down (I got their answering machine saying that it'll be down for the entire day, apparently that happens to hotels... I didn't know!) Finally, I got lucky when I finally asked someone who knew, so remember to print a couple of copies of the map of the place. It's about 10 minutes walk to Port Maillot, and I felt safe (as a female single traveller) walking at night when I was coming home.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Simon_Cooney
Reviews.Content: This hotel fits the bill if you want a clean, friendly budget hotel in Paris. Its less than 5 minutes walk to a metro stop and approx. 10 minutes walk to the Arc de Triomphe. Check in and check out is fast and the hotel is located in a nice neighbourhood. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel, not the best location”
Reviews.Author: TOchick26
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week stay at the Hotel Magellan in Paris. We arrived to a friendly, English speaking staff and although it was early for check in, our room was ready. The room was very small, with two single beds - we ended up pushing them together each night, but they were always pulled a part again the next day. The room was clean and it faced the street - which was quite noisy most nights so we didn't leave the window open. We couldn't figure out how to use the AC in the room, thankfully the weather was quite cool most days, so there wasn't a real need to use it. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They took care of making reservations to a show for us and looked after confirming our shuttle to the airport. They gave us helpful tips on taking the metro and train to various sights. As mentioned in other reviews of this hotel, it is not in the best location. Therefore, be prepared to take the metro and train everywhere. The metro and train station is about a 5min walk from the hotel, station Perrier. We did eat dinner near the hotel two nights, the best area for restaurants is near the Perrier metro station - there's a really good pizza place called San Remos. Otherwise I would recommend eating before going back to the hotel. Overall this is a nice place to stay. I would recommend it to others as long as they are prepared to take the metro a lot. When we return to Paris we will most likely stay in the Latin Quarter, which was our favorite place!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, tidy hotel”
Reviews.Author: rl29
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay at Magellan Hotel in Paris. The hotel is set out from the main hub of Paris but very accessible by metro via Pereire, which is about 5-10 min walk away. The hotel is spotlessly clean and our first impression when walking into the hotel reception was a very good one. Equally, the room/bathroom was faultless, albeit relatively small. We were situated on the 4th floor, over the reception area and street and this proved to be very quiet (except for the Monday morning when the dust carts are out early and because we had our french doors open to our balcony). The room is equipped with kettle, flat screen TV with approx 14 channels and hairdrier. Hanging space for clothing was minimal. The shower is very good (which is always important to us). The bar/lounge in the hotel is smart and a good place to unwind with friends after a busy day. Half pint beer approx 3 Euros. The drinks vending machine is ideal though for water in particular with a bottle @ 1 Euro. There is a garden which is a great bonus for a Paris hotel and a lovely place to sit with a beer if the weather is kind. Breakfast is served 7-10am and continental. It was a perfect way to start the day with the usual coffee, tea, juices, milk, various cereals, croissants, bread, jam, fruit etc and on a help yourself basis. We had breakfast around 9 each day and it was relatively busy then. Last day we were there for 7.30 and it was much quieter. From CDG airport we had paid for a train and 3 day metro pass which cost 38.50 Euros (approx £30) and the metro proved tobe a great purchase, essential. The only problem is that it lasted Fri, Sat, Sun but not Monday to get back. The only time we felt let down by the hotel was when reception advised a taxi to CDG would be around 45 euros so the 4 of us agreed to do this. Having tried to book it for Mon morning (the night before), we were told it could only be booked 15 mins before our departure time, which we did. However, at the time of departure they announced that the cost was 68 euros and that there was a 20 euro deposit to pay the hotel?? We did not see the driver take any deposit, just the extra 48 euros, so had to assume the hotel took 20E as an "arrangement fee" which we thought was naughty. Overall great break. Top trips done, Louvre, Sacre Coeur, Notre Dame, Eiffel Tower at night seen from Trocadero. Not so good, Saint Chappelle, queues in day at Eiffel. Great local restaurant Bistro Du 17eme at Avenue de Villiers just off the roundabout at Pereire metro. Aperitif, 3 courses, dessert and bottle of wine between two for 36 euros per person. Great menu, great service, great value. Suitable for older children only but perfect for couples of all ages.

Reviews.Title: “A tad far from the night life, but suited our needs just fine.”
Reviews.Author: TrueAX
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Magellan. My sister (21) and I (30) picked this hotel 100% based on the reasonable price, but twere very pleased with the overall experience. We stayed at Hotel Magellan for 9 nights. They prearranged a car for us from the airport, but it is easy to take the metro to get ther. We had no problem checking in as soon as we arrived and although as expected our room was small, it was well laid out. The breakfast was the same each day - but it was great. Try to go early as once certain items run out, they don't refresh them. Our room was always clean and the staff was lovely and helpful. The hotel is 2 a two minute walk from the closest subway station and 10 minute walk from the Arc/ Champs area. We didn't have a lot of luck with the restaurants near the hotel, so eat before you head back for the night. As the hotel is in a residential area, there isn't a real night life, so if that is what you are looking for, this hotel isn't the best choice. As others have mentioned, this hotel is very hard to find, so have a map with you if you are taking a cab from the airport, as the taxi driver may not know where it is or email the hotel asking for instructions from the closet metro station. When you get to the hotel, ask for the free map they have behind the desk and have them circle the location of the hotel. The street is so small, that you wouldn't find it otherwise. (It is by far the best map we found) Overall we enjoyed our stay at hotel Magellan.

Reviews.Title: “Smart little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in July 2008 and were pleased with it. The area itself is quiet and residential - there are a few restaurants nearby and also a couple of supermarkets open till 9pm where you can buy everything you need. It really is an easy 15 minutes walk to the Arc de Triomphe along wide boulevards with good brasseries and shops and the Metro stations at Porte de Champeret or Pereire are only 5 minutes away. ( A 1.70 euro ticket takes you anywhere on the Metro). The Bois de Boulogne is also nearby. The hotel is of a good quality - fresh and well run. The bedroom is a decent size equipped with a wardrobe (with plenty of coat hangers); there is an in room safe; flat screen TV; and a kettle The large window has an electric shutter (which is effective). This mean the curtains and the window can be left open at night to let some air in as the day time temperature last week was touching 29 C The breakfast in our opinion was excellent - there are cereals or muesli with dried figs, dates prunes and apricots to be added; yoghurts; butter and chocolate croissants ; brown or white rolls; cheeses and cold meats; fresh fruit; coffee , with hot milk available; a selection of teas ; freshly squeezed fruit juices. Breakfast can be taken in the hotel or in the lovely little garden courtyard which is a bonus to have in a city hotel. In the evening drinks are also served out there- prices are reasonable compared to what you pay in the centre of town - a bottle of chablis is 16 euros. Water and fruit drinks can be bought at any time from a cold drinks dispenser for only 1 euro . There is a very small business centre where internet access can be had. The staff are helpful - we asked which station trains for Rouen left from and they looked up the SNCF website to get train times for us. We would be very happy to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely clean modern hotel in a quiet area of paris”
Reviews.Author: K-Best
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were a little concerned we were a fair distance from the city centre (even the taxi driver had not heard of this street). However, once given a map by the hotel receptionist we decided to walk to the Arc de Triomphe and then on to the Champs Elysees which took about 15 minutes. We also discovered the short walk to the metro station Pereire which took us on the yellow line to all the major attractions very inexpensively. The trains are quite tatty really and each trip we were approached by beggars which we chose to ignore so we walked back most days. It is a long walk from the Notre Dame but well worth it along the river Seine. There does seem to be a poor choice of good restaurants nearby and they are very expensive. We ended up buying food from a supermarket and smuggling it back to our hotel room one night as we were fed up with paying £50/£60 for disappointing meals. Back to the hotel though, we got a great deal from expedia paying only £234.00 for 3 nights including breakfast. The room was small but very modern extremely clean and very cosy with a nice flat screen tv. We had a garden room which was very quiet - until you heard fellow guests showering at some unearthly hour! The breakfast was served until 10am, lots of choice, lovely freshly squeezed orange juice but if you want tea you have to ask for it. The hotel is very tastefully decorated, staff are very helpful and it is not expensive if you want a drink at the bar or room service. We are very fussy when it comes to hotels but we have to give this one 10 out of 10 for all round value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Gurnard
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel, rooms are quite small but it is clean and modern. Good self service breakfast. Great little restaurant just one street away called Table des olives. Easy to get about RER and metro stop just 5 minutes walk from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “3stars,but not more”
Reviews.Author: OsloFelicity
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a family member.The hotel is quiet.Rooms are clean,but room-service limited.Comfort of beds is no more than 3star.The bar does not serve red wine,only white wine&gave us THE look when we asked for red wine.Breakfast is a very basic. All in all, clean&quiet.Good for a city-break.many restaurants around the area for proper breakfast and a drink.would recommend it,but know its limitations.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best asset”
Reviews.Author: YourAverageTourist
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tucked away on a quiet residential street. The room that my husband and I were staying in on the 4th floor faced the street, but there was hardly any noise coming through the windows. The hotel room size was average, not big but not tiny either - it's a hotel room, what do you expect? There was a flat screen TV. The only things worth complaining about were the dirty sink in the bathroom, the really light pressure of water in the shower and the low quality of air in the room - to get fresh air we needed to open the window. The cold buffet breakfast was alright, but it was exactly the same each morning during our four day stay. The machine for squeezing fresh orange juice was a nice surprise, but it was available only on weekday mornings. The all-white selection of bread turned out to be really tough to chew. I had always thought the French appreciate soft fresh bread, but the hard pieces we were offered cannot fit the bill, can they? In general the hotel was clean and modern, a good three star hotel. The staff was friendly but not all of them spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “central small hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: EmilyFS
Reviews.Content: a small hotel that is only a couple of kilometres away from the Arc de Triomphe or the Eiffel Tower, a 10 minute walk from the Palais de Congres. Rooms are adequate, decor is muted , toiletries not very exciting, staff are friendly and courteous

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel away from hustle and bustle of Paris”
Reviews.Author: BritishgirlUk
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed five nights in the hotel and we both found it to be really clean and well kept. The room was modern though small was actually better than what I'd expect for a three star. Towels were changed everyday and toiletries were provided by the hotel. There is also room service till 3am but we never used this and so don't know if was any good. For a three star, this is was definitely above average! It was in a great location. If you are flying into Charles de Gaulle, you should catch the Air France bus from Terminal 2 (costs 20 euros approx) which takes you straight to Porte Maillot. From there you walk down Avenue de Ternes and onto Boulevard Pereire. Basically the hotel is situated on one of the side streets off Boulevard Pereire. The hotel is also near Metro Line 1 Porte Maillot and RER line A (Neilly Porte Maillot) which was approximately five/ten minutes walk. If you were to talk to Arc de Triompe, it would probably take about fifteen/twenty minutes but is a nice stroll if the weather is good. It was in a very safe location and we had no problems walking back to the hotel late at night. There are a few restaurants nearby. Breakfast was continental with croissants, cheese, hams etc and freshly squeezed orange juice which was really nice. I think the only real downside to the hotel was the small lift which only took about six people! We visited most of the sights during our visit - I'd recommend getting to each of these as early in the day as possible. We looked into buying tickets for two days on the tourist buses but worked out these were expensive in comparison to the metro plus the buses stopped after approx 6pm. We found taking the metro was much cheaper and faster so would recommend this to everyone! One place we highly recommend is Versailles which was excellent. The Chateau is beautiful and the grounds/gardens are breathtaking! Being away from the centre of Paris was very nice and relaxing and I'd recommend a day trip if the weather is good. Be warned as it is very busy during the weekends!

Reviews.Title: “We will return”
Reviews.Author: elkasa
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in this pleasant 3 star hotel. Tastefully decorated and very comfortable. Polite and friendly staff who were always willing to give advice. Room serviced every day with clean towels, top quality soaps etc. The hotel has a nice restaurant with a terrace outside where you can eat your breakfast if the weather is good. The breakfast was great. You can help yourself to as much as you want including freshly squeezed orange juice. Not that there is a shortage of places nearby if you prefer to eat elswhere. No shortage of restautrants nearby. Place Perierre is just 5 mins walk, has many on the roundabout as well as metro and Rer stations. Get a Carnet (book of ten tickets) if you want to save time but this hotel is only 15 mins from the Arc and maybe another 20 from there to the Eiffel tower. Port Maillot 10 minutes also has a metro station which is on line 1 I think which takes you straight in to the heart of the city. I would definitely go back to this hotel as it is situated in a quiet residential area with wonderful Parisian apartments not to far from all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, LOVELY LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Kaiser_Amir
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel between 30 June - 5 July 2007. I was 100% satisfied by the services and believe me I'm very picky when it comes to hotels! The room had a typical fench style = Small It was small, but not in a way that you couldn't breath or walk in it. Everything was clean and spotless. The breakfast was very good and the best thing about it was the ORANGE JUICE. It was absolutely refereshing! The Magellan hotel is located in a VERY VERY nice area of Paris. Not too far from the city center and just far enough from all the madness surrounding the Opera or the Eiffel Tower. There is a metro station near the hotel (5 minutes walk), plus a few restaurants and small shops where you can buy water, food or snacks. Also, there is a lovely park in the area and you can walk through it on your way to the metro station. All in all, this hotel is an EXCELLENT CHOICE considering the price. You'll have a wonderful time here. If I'll ever visit Paris again, I will defenitely stay at the Magellan.

Reviews.Title: “We keep returning”
Reviews.Author: Hannah48
Reviews.Content: We first went to the Hotel Magellan three years ago and we keep returning. We love Paris at any time of the year. This was our fourth visit and it is a wonderful hotel in a very quiet Paris suburb. The area is safe, plenty of nice Restaurants within walking distance. The Metro or Buses are just around the corner. The Staff in the hotel are friendly and helpful. There is a bar/lounge area just off Reception where they serve alcohol and pots of tea and coffee. Breakfast is a cold buffet which is excellent. The bedrooms/bathrooms are a reasonable size and comfortable. Good tip: If you go by Eurostar from Ashford (not sure about Waterloo) you can purchase a Paris Visite ticket which saves you having to queue on arrival in Paris to purchase Metro tickets. The Visite ticket gives you unlimited travel on the metro, trains and buses around Paris. We look forward to our next trip to Paris and our stay at the Magellan.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: peterpanExeter
Reviews.Content: My husband myself & two friends stayed at this hotel for our 60th Birthday. We emailed the hotel before our arrival to ask for certain requests and advise on a restaurant to eat on our birthday night. They gave the advice immediately. Our friends emailed and asked them to decorate our room with balloons which they didThis has made our stay all the more memorable. The rooms although smaller than English hotel rooms, were quite adequate. Very clean recently refurbished.. The bathroom was also very clean & modern.Towels clean & soft.Selection of shower gels,hair shampoo etc was available. The rest of the hotel was very clean,and new feeling. Breakfast although only continental was more than adequate. Plenty of bread,croissants,meats cheese yoghurts jams cereals tea & coffee.The staff were more than willing to assist in giving information on trips etc. All in all a brilliant hotel and one we would thoroughly recommend. The metro(Pereire) is about a 10 minute walk one way from the hotel and the Arc de Triomphe about 10 mins the other way. Two supermarkets are close by. Several bistros near the metro.Go here if you get the chance. A memorable stay and would definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Magellan
HotelInfo.Address: 17-19 Rue Jean-Baptiste Dumas | 17 Arr., 75017 Paris, France
